Client.Name: Geoscience and Remote Sensing at Chalmers University of Technology

Project.Brief history of your project and organi: The Chalmers Cloud Ice Climatology (CCIC) is a novel, deep-learning-based climate record of ice-particle concentrations in the atmosphere. CCIC results are available at high spatial and temporal resolution (0.07째 / 3 h from 1983, 0.036째 / 30 min from 2000) and thus ideally suited for evaluating high-resolution weather and climate models or studying individual weather systems.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File: The Chalmers Cloud Ice Climatology (CCIC) is a novel, deep-learning-based climate record of ice-particle concentrations in the atmosphere. CCIC results are available at high spatial and temporal resolution (0.07째 / 3 h from 1983, 0.036째 / 30 min from 2000) and thus ideally suited for evaluating high-resolution weather and climate models or studying individual weather systems.
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset: First, I downloaded the dataset from aws s3 ls --no-sign-request s3://chalmerscloudiceclimatology/ and categorized it by collection. I then created different directories to categorize the files and packaged them into car files ranging in size from 20GB to 32GB. I then distributed them to the SP via HTTP for storage.
Project.In which geographies do you plan on maki: North America, South America, Europe, Asia other than Greater China
